name: The Trafalgar Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: got a great deal thru "last minute "to stay on a friday night at this superbly located hotel, next to trafalgar square right in the heart of London. I have to agree with a previous reviewer that some, but not all, of the staff have a "holier than thou" attitude, but if you give as good as you get then they just have to put up with it. The room and facilities were both truly 1st class and although I would baulk at paying rack rate and £20 for breakfast?!? I can wholly recommend a stay especially if you can do it on the company card.
reviews.title: a great deal and a better location

reviews.text: I found the Trafalgar to be an excellent hotel. I used points for the weekend, and business expense for the other two. Some hotels will treat you slightly differently if you are on points - but I found the service to be very, very good. From the concierge helping me book my next trip (even getting show tickets in Paris) to the front desk taking immediate action when I had slight internet issues.
reviews.title: Great hotel!! I found the service fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The deluxe double room was very good - big and spacious enough to relax comfortably.
reviews.title: Unremarkable frontage but fabulous location

likes.disliked: — Too trendy approach - they are a hotel primarily not a wine bar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bad reviews on here must be people who have ridiculously high standards and can't stand even a whiff of an issue.
reviews.title: Has gotten better but still lacking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would most definitely stay here again - amazing location, great lounge area in the lobby, and good rooms!
reviews.title: Even for Londn, horrendous service

reviews.text: I highly recommend this hotel for its staff and location. We had a great stay and the staff just went above and beyond to welcome and pamper us during our time in London. I was highly impressed, which is a lot considering how picky I am. From Carlo, one of the bellman, to the concierge, to the several front desk and restaurant employees I dealt with, they were just absolutely charming. Wonderful service overall and a sure way to get me back. Location is a plus as you can do a lot by just walking, in addition to easy access to 2 metro lines within walking distance. I found the area to be really safe and we were out until late at night, dining at covent garden or the Picadilly area. We walked back to the hotel without a problem. Also, as a bit of hotel info we were upgraded to a street facing room but never heard any outside noise. We enjoyed breakfast at the hotel every single day and we weren't disappointed. We loved London but I'm certain a lot of it resides on how much we loved this hotel and the service their staff provided us.
reviews.title: Absolutely the most wonderful stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Trafalgar Hotel, part of the Hilton family, is a contemporary designed hotel directly across from Trafalgar Sq. It is within walking distance of most of the the theaters showing the most popular plays and musicals in London (but not for someone with walking difficulties). The exterior has the typical neo-classical London appearance, but the interior is all flashy and modern. There is a bar at the entrance that seemed to have every hip young person in London drinking at it when we arrived. All of the people and loud music made for a rather chaotic check in experience. Thankfully the room was quiet. The room had a dais at one end, where there was a lounge chair and TV. Like most London hotels, there was no closet or dresser for clothing, but instead a wardrobe, that didn't quite equal the space I am used to in the US. The bathroom was well fit out, with a large shower, but unfortunately was very noisy in the bedroom when the toilet was flushed or water run. All the plumbing was in the wall next to the bed.
reviews.title: Great location for theater

reviews.text: The cost was reasonable compared to other hotels in the area because Hilton was offering a discount when I booked the room.
reviews.title: Back again but with more problems than ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a bar on the roof that gave a beautiful view of London. It was a bit chilly so they had heaters going. The bar bill was extremely high for 2 drinks and crisps ($60-70). You are paying for the ambiance. There were no other people above 50 years old who we saw in this hotel during the 5 days we were there. It aims to appeal to a young, wealthy demographic
reviews.title: beware of paying extra for view of the square

reviews.text: There are lots of breakfast option just around the corner from the hotel
reviews.title: The Trafalgar

reviews.text: After reading a few bad reviews I was a bit hesitant about staying at the Trafalgar, but as there was a good price for a last minute booking and as most of my business was in central London, I didn't want the hassle of staying at Paddington or Olympia (my other two usual Hilton stays in London)
reviews.title: Pleasantly suprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked a delux room, and as a Diamond member was upgraded to a Delux plus. High floor, spacious, free water and fruit.
reviews.title: Diamond members could do better......

reviews.text: I am a bit narked that whilst they recognise your Hhonors status, they don't reward all of it. Before booking I was told I could receive a room upgrade, OR complimentry breakfast.
reviews.title: Great hotel but eat out!

reviews.text: I was pleased with a quality of the room, modern, no chitz. I thought the bed was particulary comfy (the opposite to some peoples reviews) with nice clean, soft sheets and good blackout curtains. Plenty of lighting options in the room too,
reviews.title: Beware the Trafalgar Hilton Techno Trap

likes.liked: — It was 5 minutes walking to Picadilly Circus

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was very nice, with a separate shower and deep soaking tub, lots of large bottles of toiletries. Infact the toiletries were the largest I've come across in any hotel - if only they could have been Aromapherapy Associates, like in MO's.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel - will definately return

reviews.text: Very friendly and helpful staff; good sized room overlooking Trafalgar Square. Ideal location for visiting central London. Stayed here for two nights during a three day trip - unfortunately had to leave because it was fully booked for the third night.
reviews.title: Good hotel, excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No significant problems. The restaurant's cutlery set isn't good for young children - the knives have very thin and very pointed blades. The evening restaurant only has a posh version of a "bar meal" menu, and consequently we ate out during our second night. The corridors are also dimly lit with blue lighting, which impairs vision.
reviews.title: Very pleasant experience, central location, great staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nevertheless, I enjoyed this hotel and would stay here again.
reviews.title: Just excellent!

reviews.text: This was a very easy hotel to find, very convenient coming in on the tube from Heathrow. Amazing location with easy access to everything we wanted to see on our trip. The hotel is very modern and has a very lounge-like atmosphere which isn't our speed, however, if we were younger and cooler we'd have loved that as well! The staff were incredibly helpful and nice throughout our stay, room service was quick and friendly, the food was really great. No complaints, not even the bit of noise from the lounge and street (we were on a lower floor) really bothered us. We would definitely stay here again and hope to soon.
reviews.title: Excellent choice for a tourist!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for our anniversary, great location. Hotel facilities were top notch. The bed was probably the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in, the room was very quiet and had black out curtains so had a gerat nights sleep. the roof top bar is wonderful at anytime of the day or night with fabulous views across the city. We would highly recommend.
reviews.title: The perfect place for a weekend

reviews.text: Stayed in this hotel last week, found the reception staff to be very friendly and helpful, arrived 2 hours before advertised check in time, however as room was ready we were allowed to check in and go to room and freshen up before heading off to the theatre which was only a 5 minute walk away. Although there was a little bit of noise during the night from doors banging I would most definitely stay here again. Yes it was expensive but what do you expect for central London and an ideal location.
reviews.title: Excellent location a very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location, and by far the biggest room you will get in central London for the price. This is not a super ritzy hotel and doesn't pretend to be - you get what you pay for in London, and this is a good deal.
reviews.title: biggest room in london for the price..

reviews.text: We stayed here as a family of 2 adults, 3 kids in April 13. We were given interconnecting rooms, as requested, which were well equipped, clean and trendy. Bathrooms also very clean and well equipped. We had no problems with anything at all during the stay (except other guests banging doors during the night occasionally). Front desk staff were friendly, very helpful and well organised. Special mention must go to the lovely and cheerful breakfast staff who couldnt do enough to help us. We paid £340 for 2 rooms, for one night, which isnt cheap, but i did feel it was good value for (very) central London. Buses to everywhere leave from right outside the front door, so getting around was easy and cheap. There is a Pret a Manger and Cafe Nero next door if you need extra water/coffee etc. I consider myself to be a fussy customer who has stayed in some terrible places and some great ones...The staff were unfailingly polite and helpful to us - a very big thank you to them all!
reviews.title: Great stay, fantastic location, friendly helpful staff
Great location
reviews.text: Friendly welcoming staff. Room clean but smaller than expected. Mind you doesn't get much better than waking up to see Trafalgar Square with Nelsons Column! Surprise that not even any water in the room and breakfast option very expensive

Myself and a friend stayed here last weekend and while we had a very nice stay it really is all about the location. The minimalist decor (complete with near darkness in the corridors/lifts) is more like bareness in the rooms themselves. We were advised at check-in that our twin room was made up as a double and that they would up-grade us instead. I am not sure that they did because the room was actually made up correctly and I would have hated to see the standard room if what we got (Room 220) was an upgrade. The room was fine if a little bare - first time I have ever stayed in a hotel room where the cupboards were just that, cupboards, as opposed to built in furniture. Little enough in terms of toiletries in the bathroom which was of the ancient variety. In fact a bit of grouting and re-fitting was in dire need in the bathroom. All was clean but well past its prime. Our room looked out on to the back of the hotel and each morning we were treated to a wake up call between 7 and 7.30 which was the bottle bank being emptied into a bottle collecting truck. All that said the staff were friendly, the bill was high but correct and the location was brilliant. We were going to a show in Haymarket so the location had driven our choice in the first place - I would stay there again but only if I was attending a show as we could easily walk back to the hotel afterwards. I am not great on navigating the tube system at night (yes I know its easy but I have long since accepted that I wont be doing it past 9pm) so this was a great choice as it was close enough without being in the West End theatre mayhem.
reviews.title: Its all about location - pricey for the size of room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As other reviews have said this hotel has a great location you can't fault that. We booked a double room, upgraded and were given a very spacious room on the first floor(109) with an oblique view of Trafalgar Square.
reviews.title: Lack of attention to detail

reviews.text: The hotel is all about chic modern, minimal, clean lines which is great provided it is done properly. The bedroom was lovely with a really comfortable bed and loads of space but that space was because apart from a desk, swivel chair and coffee table there was nothing else in there to sit on. These bits of furniture were weirdly huddled up together just making the empty floor space LOOK like something was missing. I mentioned this lack of seating when we went to use the bar and expected 'something' to have been moved in while we were away. Nothing happened - and still nothing when we returned from dinner. Next morning we mentioned it again and to be frank although the staff were perfectly pleasant I felt like we were asking for a unicorn to be put in the room. No surprise then that a chair/s never appeared. Maybe it was because we are not the target demographic for this boutique hotel but that is a big mistake to make. I admire good design I like staying in hotels like this but style should never overrule function.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom again was spacious with separate shower but looked very tired with cracked tiles and dirty worn grout (If I don't tolerate this at home why would I want to pay hundreds of pounds a night for it?) There was also a used glass of water left after the room had been 'cleaned'.
reviews.title: Spacious room

reviews.text: We did try the television but as only 1 channel was available (the remote and the manual buttons didn't work) and there was nowhere comfortable to sit apart from the bed we didn't bother. Surely being ready for your guests is the bare minimum of customer service and this lack of attention to detail is really disappointing.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel in an outstanding location!

reviews.text: The hotel is in very easy walking distance to the Houses of Parliament, Coventry Garden and South Bank so great if you want to be in the thick of it. Nice enough decor (very modern/minimalistic) but for some reason the lighting in the corridors is so dim it's too dark in a lot of areas. Choose this hotel first and foremost for the location but don't expect any oldy-worldy London hotel charm. Also whilst this is listed as a Hilton there are no signs of the brand anywhere.
reviews.title: Good hotel in the center of everything.

reviews.text: The location of the Trafalgar Hotel cannot be beaten, in the middle of London, near all attractions and underground/bus around the corner.
reviews.title: Great location, friendly staff, room service a bit slot

reviews.text: The rooms are what you might expect of a Hilton room, clean, spacious, and efficiently decorated.
reviews.title: The VIP's hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is helpful and friendly, although it took quite a long time before the diner I've ordered was delivered (had to call twice to ask when it would arrive). Because of the delay, a complementary bottle of wine was provided. Also, the additional blanket I requested was removed after the room was cleaned, so I had to request another one for the second night (which took quite a long time, just as with the room service)
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Amazing hotel!
reviews.title: MW Highly recommended boutique in literally the HEART of London's West End

reviews.text: Location is bang on central London, in Trafalgar Square with underground and many bus routes.
reviews.title: Perfect stay

reviews.text: If you are looking for a centrally located place to stay that has great service and nice rooms, this is it. The rooms are not cheap, but nothing in London is, but they are certainly worth every penny. From this location you can walk most anywhere in the city and save the cab fare. The rooms are nice, we had 2 at different ends of the floor and both were equally appointed and maintained. The staff was always helpful and available.
reviews.title: Great Location, Good Service, Nice Rooms

reviews.text: Wow - I wish Hilton properties in the US looked after their guests the way this property does. I have traveled close to 1000 nights over the last 10-years and the staff at this property rates in the top 5 locations ever. The location is right on Trafalgar Square and is within walking distance to Buckingham Palace, the London Eye, the British Museum, Big Ben, Westminster Abbey, several bus stops, a few tube stations, etc, etc - a top location for a tourist. All are within 10-15 minutes walk.
reviews.title: Absolutely Brilliant !!! - Great Central London Location with Top Staff

reviews.text: The hotel has a roof top patio that was unfortunately closed due it not being in season yet (opens in April I believe); however, this did not diminish our stay. The restaurant is on the bottom floor and had wonderful staff. There is a bar / coffee & sitting area on the main floor. Be aware that this area could be a little loud in the evenings, but only added to the experience and was a good place to grab a coffee or pint of beer. There was some street noise - mostly sirens from police or ambulances going by, but this is to be expected in any major city center. Again - location can not be beat!
reviews.title: We LOVE this hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Restaurants are plentiful including a McDonald's and Little Frankies (American style food) within a couple of blocks. Breakfast at the hotel was great with excellent service and was included with our stay because of being a Hilton Hhonors members.
reviews.title: Absolute favorite!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed twice due to a 2-day break in Paris and stayed in two different rooms at this property. Both were similar and both were clean, very comfortable, and updated and good sized bathrooms. The hotel featured daily room service and also an evening turn-down service that we just couldn't pass up!
reviews.title: PMorris

reviews.text: This is a glass and drapes bathed in low designer lighting place. You can't see a thing. The prices are crazy. We paid £24 for two glasses of wine and two waters. Still, it is a Hilton.
reviews.title: Dark and dingy

reviews.text: Although there were some improvements that were sorely needed (the elevators weren't working for 5 of the 7 days we were there), the location and the staff at the hotel made you overlook the negatives. It's a predominantly young group of employees who are very friendly and eager to help. The housekeeping service was very good, and the maintenance staff extremely attentive. The minute we notified them of something that needed tending to, it was fixed.
reviews.title: Perfect location, lovely staff

reviews.text: I stayed at the Trafalgar in Oct 2011 for two nights. Having stayed 6 times with them and being HH Gold, you would expect some decent treatment by their front desk or service relations manager.
reviews.title: Never Again - Should not be part of the Hilton Group

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked the stay on points and cash and presented by reward certficate upon check in. I was assigned a terrible room that they call deluxe, failing to realize that I had already stayed in their deluxe or deluxe plus rooms before. The room was badly set up, had a waterpipes closet in it, with sounds all night. It was also badly maintained with different color light bulbs on each side of the room. Cleanliness was also not their forte.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay ... great location!

reviews.text: I asked for late departure that they indicated it was complimentary given my HH status. Upon exit, i settled my bill and all was fine, I saw a guestroom charge which seemed like the cash part of my points and cash reward.
reviews.title: Feb 18-20, 2012
Good London Option
reviews.text: I've stayed at the Trafalgar Hilton twice. Both stays were nice. Room is larger than one would expect. Staff is friendly and helpful. Bar is nice - quiet in the morning for coffee and wireless access, more happening in the evening but you wouldn't know it once the elevator doors close. Fitness facilities are nice enough, though it's odd that the front desk staff has to let you in. The location is great.
Biggest downside is that my shower leaked in both rooms I've stayed in. Nothing major, really more of a hassle.
reviews.title: Surprisingly good
had a pleasent stay
reviews.text: Be sure to request a room in the back, or at least not right on Trafalgar Square. View is super, but the noise kept me up all night during my first stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well I nearly did not stay here because of some the previous reviews, especially the discussion of poor front desk experience. But either they read Tripadvisor or they have read their own hotel review cards because my experience was great. I stayed a week and the front desk found someone to fix the curtains in my room at 11pm, printed maps for out of central london restaurants and checked me into my flight, all very helpful. Now it's not the most 5* place but it does everything that can be expected for the money and more, the rooms are larger than some at even the best hotels (the ones at the metropolitan are tiny in comparsion) and the bar goes off every night but upstairs all is quiet. A good bet for business and leisure and at a great price for central London
reviews.title: Employees Inept/Great location

reviews.text: stayed there from january 31st until february 2nd 2007.
reviews.title: After all, a good choice

reviews.text: A group of three of us were booked into a double and a twin interconnecting room for one nights stay. When we arrived we were greeted by a man standing at a random desk - it was reception, apparently. Just a desk with a computer on it - we could see everything that was on the computer and it was not comfortable at all. The receptionists looked very uncomfortable with it all aswel.
reviews.title: Shocked at appauling service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The receptionist seemed to have a bit of an attitude problem. He lookeed cocky and felt like he was lookig down upon us - as if he was superior. A very smug, 'up himself' look when handing us the key. We checked in no problem though and were very impressed with the rooms. Full sized toiletries, bathrobes, slippers, cd player, dvd player etc. Very comfortable beds too.
reviews.title: Don't be put off by my rating!

reviews.text: When we had dinner in the restuarant which felt more like a corner 'greasy spoon' cafe with about 7 or 8 tables, one of our party ordered the "Hilton Burger". The waitress raised her eyebrows and said loudly "What? You're having the burger?? For dinner??". Very, very embarrassing and rude. Why shouldn't we order what ever we like? Why the aggro? When we replied with a simple but stern "Yes!", she said "Ok" very sarcastically. Food was lovely, really good quality. I could spot a trend here.
reviews.title: My Hot Tip for a London stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we went to the bar, we were interested to see what was on the bar menu. When we asked politely to see it, the barman said "Well, I can only do that if I see your ID" in a very serious tone. I replied "Are you serious? You want my ID to read the bar food menu?" "yes" he replied. I reluctantly gave it to him, then he read it, handed it back and said "haha yeah thats fine". He was playing games with us, but not in a jokey way. He was genuinely enjoying mocking us.
reviews.title: Great, Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the bar there was extremely loud DJ music, which was dreadful. We couldn't have a peaceful drink. It was like being in a night club, and with reception being right next to the bar, I felt sorry for people checking in whilst this noise was going on.
reviews.title: What a great surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is trying to be cool but it just can't pull it off. The decor doesn't quite make it and is still. Soul-less chain. The service was embarrassing at times, especially in the lobby restaurant. The roof top bar is staffed with young male that have no idea how to cater to tourists. The linens in the hotel are old and worn out. We used points to stay for free but paid Slight charge to upgrade...Probably worth it. Doubt I'd come back. The area is kind of gross (like Time Sq in NYC.)
reviews.title: Sad but not tragic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had the BEST experience at this hotel. It was our 35th Anniversary and they went out of their way with rose petals, chocolate strawberries and all kinds of special touches ready for us in our lovely, large room with great amenities. Daniela at the front desk is amazing, fun, sweet and attentive to every detail. The location is right on Trafalgar Square, so it was a quick walk to Buckingham Palace, The Parliament Bldgs, Westminster Cathedral, and the British Museum. The breakfast on the weekend was also quite elegant and delicious, everything you could want. On our last night there we tried their roof top bar/restaurant that had eye popping views and a wonderful ambiance to enjoy. This really is the place to visit on your next trip to London.
reviews.title: Fun, Amazing Personal Service, Fabulous Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Trafalgar for a night when we were planning to see Les Miserables, a great location for the West End.
reviews.title: Great mix of funky modern and classic hotel, great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby and all common areas are ultra-modern and very funky, I was really impressed upon arrival. The Czech girl who checked us in was so bright, fun and friendly it was an absolute pleasure to arrive.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location...and funky disco elevator!

reviews.text: The rooms are massive, and a good mix of classic old style 5 star hotel with a modern twist. Ours had a great view directly over Trafalgar Square, which was great.
reviews.title: Great for a family break with a personal touch

description: The Trafalgar is located on the world-famous Trafalgar Square, many of London's star attractions within walking distance, such as the London Eye, Big Ben and Theatreland. Modern and boutique, the hotel facilities include Rockwell Bar & Restaurantr enowned for serving innovative cocktails with international cuisine and Vista, the rooftop bar that offers breathtaking views of London. There are 129 rooms, many with superb views of the square, all featuring DVD Players, high-speed internet and aromatherapy toiletries. Guests also enjoy complimentary use of the state- of- the-art gym and free access to Vista rooftop bar, weather permitting.
